text.p: The following are leading domestic stories in Portuguese newspapers.
*According to the European Commission, Portugal will loose 10 to 40 percent of its European development funds after the year 2000 with the inclusion of new members.
*A fire at tyre retreading company Recauchutagem Imperio, near Braga, in northern Portugal, caused four billion escudos of damage and put jobs of 250 workers at risk.

*Administration of Somincor, manager of the Neves Corvo copper mine in southern Portugal, is inflexible in its decision to establish seven-day shifts. Workers began an indefinite strike on Monday in protest.

*IBM, which has 40 percent of the outstanding debts of computer services company Reditus, asked for it to be declared technically bankrupt but move was opposed by obanks holding the remaining 60 percent.
*After checking its data with that of the National Statistics Institute, the Agriculture Ministry admits there may have been illegal imports of beef from the Britain.
*Oil company Petrogal registered a 3.3 billion escudo loss up to May. The result was an improvement on the seven billion escudos lost up to March.
